questions.question: What is the name of the hypothetical particle that mediates the force of gravity in quantum mechanics?
Which law of thermodynamics states that entropy always increases in an isolated system?
What is the rarest naturally occurring element on Earth?
What is the Chandrasekhar limit?
options: The maximum mass of a white dwarf star before it collapses
The minimum temperature for nuclear fusion
The point at which a neutron star forms
The maximum speed a star can rotate before disintegration
questions.answer: The maximum mass of a white dwarf star before it collapses

questions.question: Which quantum mechanical principle states that certain pairs of physical properties cannot be simultaneously measured with high precision?
What is the name of the process by which plants release water vapor into the atmosphere?
Which fundamental force is responsible for holding atomic nuclei together?
What is the approximate age of the universe according to current scientific estimates?
What is the most abundant element in the Earth's crust?
What type of galaxy is the Milky Way classified as?
